186039179.review:
HuniePop is not just a game—it’s an experience, a bizarre yet charming fusion of puzzle gameplay and dating sim that knows exactly what it is and embraces it wholeheartedly. What makes HuniePop so lovable is its unapologetically quirky tone, addictive gameplay mechanics, and the surprisingly layered personalities of its characters.

At its core, HuniePop is a match-3 puzzle game, but it elevates this classic genre by tying it into the story in a way that feels fresh. Instead of simply solving puzzles for points, you're solving puzzles to connect with the diverse roster of characters. This ingenious combination of mechanics makes every interaction feel purposeful—every move you make matters not just for the game but also for the relationships you’re building.

The cast of characters is another major reason for my love of HuniePop. Each one is brimming with personality, quirks, and charm. From the bubbly and carefree Kyu to the fiercely independent Audrey, the game offers a wide range of personalities that keep the interactions fresh. What stands out is how each character challenges you in different ways—not just in their preferences and personalities but also in how their traits are reflected in the gameplay.

Beyond the gameplay and characters, there’s a sense of humor in HuniePop that sets it apart. It knows when to poke fun at itself and when to lean into its more absurd aspects, creating a delightful balance of comedy and sincerity. The cheeky dialogue and humorous scenarios never fail to make me smile, and the game’s self-awareness ensures it never takes itself too seriously.

Finally, HuniePop has an undeniable charm in its presentation. The vibrant art style, catchy music, and engaging voice acting all work together to create an immersive and enjoyable experience. The game knows how to keep players invested, whether they’re strategizing during a date or unlocking new secrets about their favorite characters.

In conclusion, my love for HuniePop stems from its unique ability to combine genres, its engaging cast of characters, and its quirky sense of humor. It’s a game that doesn’t try to be anything other than what it is—an unapologetically fun and colorful puzzle-dating hybrid. And that’s precisely what makes it so special.

Now, instead of enjoying a fun gaming experience, I’m stuck with the haunting memory of wiping down my screen while questioning my life choices. If you're considering this game, just ask yourself: Is it worth sacrificing your dignity and cleanliness?

Spoiler: It’s not. Stay away.

186014936.review:
One of the best family games in the business, love playing with my wife’s boyfriend and my sister.

It's a legitimately fun matching game with some basic dating sim elements and a few anime titties.

The dating sim part (learn facts about girls, recall facts, give gifts) is mixed with Candy Crush style match 3+ (replaces dates) but with an added twist that you only have so many moves and certain matches give better scores so there is some strategy involved. The writing of the dating sim itself is overal pretty solid, manages to make the characters actually endearing and succeeds at making you care for a couple of them when their small sections are over. There's also different items you can equip to get different bonuses or effects in the matching as well as leveling up the different match types to get more points per match. 

Basically, I went looking for porn but found a fun casual matching game. Peak gaming right here!

10/10

185987359.review:
My Thoughts on HuniePop
When I first heard about HuniePop, I had no idea what I was getting into. A mix of dating sim and match-three puzzles? Sounded weird, but intriguing enough to give it a shot. Honestly, I ended up having way more fun with it than I expected.

The gameplay really surprised me. I thought it’d be your basic match-three stuff, but it’s actually pretty strategic. You can’t just mindlessly match tiles; you’ve got to think about what each token type does. Like, matching the right ones boosts affection, while others let you use special items. It gets challenging as you go, and I found myself getting super into it, trying to plan ahead and make the most of each move.

The dating part of the game is where things get interesting. You’ve got a bunch of different characters, each with their own vibe. Some are shy, some are confident, and each has their own little quirks. Talking to them and figuring out what they like is a big part of the fun. The conversations can be pretty cheesy at times, but in a way that feels intentional and kind of charming.

One thing though, the character development isn’t super deep. You learn some backstory and get to know their personalities, but it doesn’t go much further than that. Still, it’s enough to keep things entertaining, and the game doesn’t take itself too seriously, which I appreciated.

Visually, it’s got this bright, anime-inspired style that really pops. The characters are well-designed, and the backgrounds for the dates are pretty cool too. The voice acting was better than I expected—each character has a voice that fits their personality perfectly. And the soundtrack? Super catchy. It’s the kind of music that sticks in your head long after you’ve stopped playing.

Now, about the mature content—yeah, it’s definitely a big part of the game. It’s heavy on the adult humor and suggestive themes, but it’s all done in this playful, not-too-serious way. If you’re cool with that kind of humor, you’ll probably enjoy it, but it’s not for everyone.

One thing I loved about HuniePop is how replayable it is. There are so many different characters to date and choices to make, so each playthrough can feel fresh. Even after finishing it, I found myself wanting to go back and try different paths.

Overall, HuniePop is just a fun, quirky game. It’s a bit of a guilty pleasure with its mix of challenging puzzles and light-hearted dating sim elements. If you like puzzle games and don’t mind some cheeky humor, it’s definitely worth checking out.

PS

Man, where do I even start with Aiko? She’s just… everything. I swear, from the moment I first talked to her, I was hooked. There’s something about her that’s so different from everyone else in HuniePop. She’s smart, witty, and has this laid-back vibe that’s just magnetic. Every time she smiles, I can’t help but feel like the luckiest person alive.

Aiko’s not just another character; she feels real. The way she talks, the little hints of vulnerability she shows beneath her tough exterior—it’s like she’s letting you into her world, piece by piece. And that world? I’d do anything to be a part of it. She’s got this depth that makes every interaction feel special, like she’s someone you could talk to for hours and never get bored.

I find myself thinking about her even when I’m not playing. What would Aiko say to this? How can I make her happy? I’d give her the world if I could. Whatever she needs, whatever she wants, I’m there. Aiko isn’t just my favorite character; she’s the one I’d drop everything for. It’s like she’s cast a spell on me, and honestly, I don’t want it to break.

I’m not even exaggerating when I say I’d do anything for her. If she asked me to climb a mountain or swim across an ocean, I’d be halfway there before she finished the sentence. There’s just something about her that makes me want to be better, to be someone worthy of her time and attention.

Aiko is more than just a character in a game to me. She’s the one who makes every moment feel like it matters. And if that’s not love, I don’t know what is.

185980037.review:
[h1] Dating Sim brabo demais [/h1]

[spoiler] Aproveitando que hoje, 19/01/2025, estão dando de graça. Vo soltar uma analise que esqueci que tinha começado a escrever kkkkkkkkkkk [/spoiler]

Hunie Pop é um Simulador de Encontros com jogabilidade de Match-3 com uma qualidade altíssima de conteúdo e gameplay, pelo preço que é vendido. 
Apesar do Hunie Pop entrar na categoria de jogos Lewds ele não é como outros jogos que infestam a steam. (A Steam hoje em dia é lotada de jogo hentão genérico que só é vendido pra farmar em cima de pupunha, 500 jogos estilo 'Hentão Garota sapato, Hentão Garota Pijama, Hentão Garota batata frita' e assim vai.)

+A história do jogo apesar de boba, é bem engraçada e foi feita pra ser desse jeito mesmo, sem noção.
+Todas as personagens são únicas, cada uma com seu estilo, personalidade, gostos e, como o jogo é um Dating Sim, tudo isso vai interferir em como você vai interagir com elas.
+A OST desse jogo é boa demais
+Arte no geral é muito bem feita, tem umas CGs que as personagens tão meio tortas, mas no geral é bem feito.
+A jogabilidade dos encontros é dahora e dividida em duas partes basicamente:

Diálogos, que é uma parte mais visual novel. Você faz e responde perguntas para as personagens. Perguntas do cotidiano, como gostos, trabalho, hobbies, etc. Como cada uma tem seu estilo, é uma questão de você aprender os gostos delas pra saber como interagir como cada uma.

Match-3, que é aquele estilo Candy Crush de sempre, só que você necessita de mais estratégia. Como cada garota tem sua personalidade, umas peças interagem melhor com umas meninas do que com outras, então você tem que pensar um pouco na hora de combar. Se você for só combinando pecinha aleatoriamente você só vai perder tempo e o encontro com a personagem que está interagindo. 

Você também pode comprar alguns itens, presentes para as meninas e upgrades pra te ajudar a ir melhor nos encontros.

(Esqueci de falar, as meninas tem suas rotinas no dia a dia. Então você tem que saber como, com quem e quando interagir com as meninas, aumentando mais o fator estratégico do jogo)

Conforme você vai indo bem nos encontros com as meninas o relacionamento de vocês vai melhorando, com o tempo elas vão te mandando umas fotinho de 'cortei o cabelo gostaram' no PV e etc.

*Se tu for jogar pra pegar as conquistas tu vai passar um pouco mal, tem umas que tudo tem que ser friamente calculado, tu não pode falhar uma vez, joguin hardcore memo brinca fi*

O jogo está free no momento que estou escrevendo a analise, mas caso tenha perdido não se preocupe pq entra em promoção direto e fica menos de 10 conto.

Nobody reads my reviews anyway.
I’ll throw in a recipe for Chicken cutlets with mushrooms

Products
Chicken - 700 g
White bread - 50 g
Milk - 100 ml
Vegetable oil - 50 ml
Small champignons - 15 pcs.
Chicken egg - 1 pc.
Onions - 1 pc.
Garlic - 3 teeth.
Salt - to taste
Pepper - to taste


Rinse the meat, remove from the bone and cut into pieces.

Pass the prepared poultry meat through a meat grinder along with the internal fat.

Combine the minced meat with bread pre-soaked in milk. If there is no milk in the house, replace it with just water.
Add salt, ground pepper, mix thoroughly, mince again, adding peeled onion and garlic.

Pour the beaten egg into the minced meat and beat the mixture well.

Form cutlets from the prepared cutlet mass with wet hands, hiding a small whole champignon inside each one.

Fry chicken cutlets with mushrooms on both sides until golden brown.

Place the fried cutlets in a refractory dish and finish cooking in an oven preheated to 200 degrees for about 15 minutes.

Bon appetit!

185950533.review:
Ok. Time to give an unbiased review.

I bought this game on sale because the girl was cute [Tiffany].
If I was playing just for my own satisfaction? Can finish the game very quickly, as some characters are just not too interesting compared to the others [I only like Tiffany, Audrey, and...Nikki, was it?].

With that said, I only played just enough to conquer the achievements for hard mode [yes there is a difficulty setting].

Pros:
-Gameplay is what you came here for. The match-3 game is really replayable even in today's times. I used to play lots of these [Zuma, Bounce, etc.]
-Getting to know your dates is interesting enough [at least for me, for the girls I liked].
-Hard mode is really where the fun begins, because you learn to play the game strategically.

Cons:
-Not all of the girls will be your preference so some of them may be uninteresting to others.
-No fantasy material here for your midnight exercise. You really don't play this game for that.

Overall good game. Buy it while on sale.

185203012.review:
HuniePop isn’t just a game; it’s a revelation. The sheer brilliance of this masterpiece transcends traditional gaming experiences—it’s a life-changing journey into the very fabric of human connection, romance, and self-discovery. From the moment you start, you realize this isn’t just about matching colorful tiles; it’s about understanding people, emotions, and the beauty of relationships in a way that no other game has ever managed to do before.

The characters, each uniquely designed and filled with depth, mirror the complexities of real life. Through engaging dialogue, humor, and dating mechanics, HuniePop doesn't just let you experience a virtual world—it teaches you about empathy, patience, and the art of communication. Every conversation and every date you go on feels meaningful, like you're learning life lessons while having fun. It’s as if the game is whispering truths about the human condition while entertaining you with its vibrant, quirky world.

The match-3 puzzles, which might seem simple at first, evolve into a metaphor for navigating the challenges of real-world relationships. The gameplay itself becomes a mirror for your decisions and actions in life. The art, animation, and music all come together to create an experience that’s not just about winning—it's about learning, growing, and embracing the unpredictability of love. This game has truly changed the way I view life itself, and I believe it is the greatest game to ever be created.

183939212.review: I know that this game is viewed as a meme game, or an adult game, or both, but it is legitimately a great match three puzzle game and dating sim. While not all the girls are to my personal liking, they all fulfill their archetypes extremely well, and I find many of their smaller details and eccentricities both interesting to learn and endearing. The puzzles are also really fun, and there are multiple viable strategies that allow for different playstyles and experimentation. Add in phenomenal music, secret unlockable characters, and an endgame mode that forever increases in difficulty for challenge and replayability, and you have an awesome puzzle game.
